Development Journey

🧭 Development Journey: Complete Documentation

Welcome to our comprehensive development journey documentation! This is where we track every detail of our 18-week AI-first father-son experiment in educational software development.

📖 Journey Overview

🎯 The Experiment

Transforming a 12-year-old’s 5-minute voice memo into a production-ready educational game using 95% AI autonomy with minimal human intervention for educational validation and safety oversight.

🚀 Core Hypothesis

Can AI agents autonomously transform a child’s creative vision into production-ready educational software?

✅ The Answer: YES!

Through structured AI collaboration, comprehensive Copilot instructions, and iterative prompt engineering.

📅 Week-by-Week Development Logs

✅ Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-2) - COMPLETED

🏗️ Week 1: Planning & Architecture

AI Autonomy: 95% | Status: ✅ Complete

AI-led technical architecture design from voice memo analysis. Complete technical specification generated through iterative prompt refinement.

  • ✅ Voice memo analysis & requirement extraction
  • ✅ Complete technical architecture design
  • ✅ Technology stack selection (.NET 8, Blazor, Azure)
  • ✅ Educational framework & AI agent personalities
  • ✅ 50+ page technical specification created

🚀 Week 2: Foundation Implementation

AI Autonomy: 92% | Status: ✅ Complete

Complete .NET Aspire solution built with GitHub Copilot. Educational game foundation fully functional and ready for game engine development.

  • ✅ Complete .NET Aspire solution (5 projects)
  • ✅ Entity Framework Core with educational domain models
  • ✅ Blazor Server with child-friendly TailwindCSS UI
  • ✅ SignalR real-time communication setup
  • ✅ PostgreSQL integration via Aspire orchestration

🎮 Phase 2: Game Engine (Weeks 3-6) - IN PROGRESS

🎮 Week 3: Core Game Engine

AI Autonomy: 90% | Status: 🟡 In Progress

Implementing the 6-phase educational game loop with dice mechanics, resource management, and interactive game flow.

  • 🟡 Dice-based career progression system
  • 🟡 Resource management (Income, Reputation, Happiness)
  • ⭕ Random event card system
  • ⭕ Game state persistence and real-time updates

🤖 Week 4: AI Agent Framework

Planned AI Autonomy: 95% | Status: ⭕ Planned

Implementing 6 specialized AI agent personalities with educational objectives and child-appropriate content.

🌍 Week 5: Real-World Data Integration

Planned AI Autonomy: 85% | Status: ⭕ Planned

World Bank GDP API integration, territory acquisition system, and real economic data for educational value.

🗣️ Week 6: Speech Recognition Foundation

Planned AI Autonomy: 80% | Status: ⭕ Planned

Azure Speech Services integration for pronunciation assessment and multi-language learning challenges.

🏆 Major Milestones

✅ Milestone 1: Complete Architecture Foundation

🏗️ Foundation Built - Week 2 Complete

Achievement: Complete .NET Aspire educational game foundation

AI Autonomy Level: 93% overall with minimal human intervention

Impact: 10x faster development than traditional approach

Deliverables:

  • ✅ 5-project .NET Aspire solution that builds successfully
  • ✅ Educational domain models with child-appropriate game mechanics
  • ✅ Child-friendly Blazor UI with TailwindCSS styling
  • ✅ Real-time SignalR communication framework
  • ✅ COPPA-compliant safety and privacy architecture

🎯 Milestone 2: First Playable Version

🎮 MVP Game Engine - Week 4 Target

Target: Functional educational game with all 6 phases

Current Progress: 30% complete

AI Autonomy Target: 90%

🚀 Milestone 3: AI Agent Personalities

🤖 Educational AI Integration - Week 6 Target

Target: 6 working AI agents with distinct personalities

AI Autonomy Target: 95%

🎯 Journey Summary

Follow our 18-week AI-first experiment as we prove that modern AI agents can autonomously transform a child's creative vision into production-ready educational software. Every decision, every line of code, and every breakthrough is documented in real-time.

Current Status: Week 3 of 18 • AI Autonomy: 93% average • Educational Goal: Teaching 12-year-olds economics, geography, and languages through engaging gameplay
